rows.title: Define balloon
Setup slider handler

2.title: Judgment
2.content: How far would you like to inflate the balloon?

4.title: Result
4.content: ${ window.makeBalloon(this.state.pumps, this.parameters.burstPoint, this.state.pumps) }

rows.title: Calculate payoff

5.title: Feedback
5.content:
Your balloon ${ this.state.burst ? 'burst' : 'held' }, so you received
${ this.state.currentPoints } Points
In total, you have collected ${ this.state.totalPoints } points so far.

39.title: Instructions
39.content:
Your task

The goal of the following task is to inflate balloons. You will decide how far to inflate it — the further you inflate it, the more points you can gain.

However, the balloons can also burst, in which case you will not receive any points. The more you inflate a balloon, the more likely it is that it will burst.

Whether balloons burst or not is a matter of luck — some burst with just the smallest amount of air, some don't burst even if they are inflated to the limit. Almost every balloon bursts at some point, though.

In the following, please indicate how far you would like to inflate the balloon using a slider. A visualization indicates the size that the balloon will reach. With the click of a button, the balloon is slowly inflated to that level.

40.title: Thanks
40.content:
Thank you!

The experiment is now complete.

Thank you for taking the time!

You can now close this window.

metadata.title: BART
metadata.description:
Automatic version of the Balloon Analogue Risk Task, as presented in Pleskac et al. (2008).

Pleskac, T. J., Wallsten, T. S., Wang, P., & Lejuez, C. W. (2008). Development of an automatic response mode to improve the clinical utility of sequential risk-taking tasks. Experimental and Clinical Psychopharmacology, 16(6), 555â€“564. https://doi.org/10.1037/a0014245
